title: Police Officers Fired Over Selfies at Elijah McClain's Memorial Site
summary: Photos appeared to mimic chokehold used in McClain's death; union calls investigation a rush to judgment. Several Colorado police officers were fired Friday over photos that appeared to mock the chokehold death of Elijah McClain.

title: Mexico's Covid-19 Death Toll Could Be Twice as High as Official Tally
summary: Count by government agency suggests more than 50,000 dead. MEXICO CITY-Mexico's true death toll from coronavirus is nearly double the government's official count, according to a review of data from a Mexican government agency that suggests the country now has more than 50,000 coronavirus deaths.

title: Iran Looking at Possible Sabotage in Recent Blasts
summary: Official suggests U.S. was behind incidents or possibly local opposition groups. Iran said it was looking at possible sabotage following recent blasts at several key Iranian sites, including the country's main nuclear facility, a senior official said Friday, deepening the mystery around these incidents after other authorities initially sought to play down any suggestion of foul play.

title: U.S. Sends Aircraft Carriers to Asia for Exercises as China Holds Drills Nearby
summary: USS Reagan, USS Nimitz to visit South China Sea's disputed waters while Chinese navy holds drills there. The U.S. is sending two aircraft carriers into one of Asia's hottest spots to deliver a pointed message to China that it doesn't appreciate Beijing's military ramp-up in the region.

title: Dozens of U.S. Diplomats to Leave Saudi Arabia as Virus Outbreak Worsens
summary: As infections in the kingdom surged, diplomats were rattled by death of an embassy driver and worries about hospital care. Dozens of U.S. diplomats and their families are leaving Saudi Arabia this weekend amid a surge in new coronavirus cases, drawing into focus the kingdom's struggle in containing the outbreak as it reopens its economy.

title: Colombian Army Soldiers Accused of Raping Girls
summary: Commander says internal probe is under way; 'we are committed to using all of our powers against any alleged abuses'. BOGOTÁ, Colombia-Allegations that Colombian army soldiers kidnapped and raped girls in remote corners of the country inhabited by indigenous communities have sparked public outrage here and led an American senator to call for broad changes in the U.S.-backed military.

title: Emmanuel Macron's Reform Restart
summary: The President wants a new team for France after Covid-19.. French Prime Minister Édouard Philippe resigned Friday, as President Emmanuel Macron tries to restart his reform agenda. It's not surprising for a French leader to replace a government midway through his term, but this is one of Mr. Macron's biggest gambles ahead of the 2022 presidential election.

title: Washington's NFL Team to Undertake 'Thorough Review' of Redskins Name
summary: The team will likely be renamed before the 2020 season amid mounting pressure from sponsors and fans. The Washington Redskins said they are undertaking a "thorough review" of their team name amid pressure from fans and sponsors that they should abandon the moniker commonly seen as a racial slur.

title: Abolition and the American Founding
summary: Today's leftists denounce the Declaration and Constitution as pro-slavery. It's not a new argument, political scientist C. Bradley Thompson says.. As America celebrates Independence Day amid a bitter election campaign and political disorder in the streets, C. Bradley Thompson's mind is on the time when the country first came together. Mr. Thompson, 61, is a political-science professor at South Carolina's Clemson University and author, most recently, of "America's Revolutionary Mind" (2019). The book takes its theme from John Adams's 1815 observation, in a letter to Thomas Jefferson, that the true American Revolution took place not on battlefield but "in the Minds of the People, from 1760 to 1775, in the course of fifteen Years before a drop of blood was drawn at Lexington."

title: A New Chapter in Fraught Ties Between President, Spies
summary: Intelligence officers find challenges in keeping a prickly Trump informed of world-wide conditions, current and former officials say. WASHINGTON-President Trump's combative relationship with U.S. intelligence agencies has made it difficult for officials to speak candidly to him or the public about national security threats throughout his tenure, particularly those involving Russia, according to current and former officials.

title: Turkish Judge Releases Manager, Pilots in Ghosn Escape Trial
summary: Accused of migrant smuggling, five men were freed pending a verdict in the trial. ISTANBUL-A Turkish judge ordered the release of five defendants accused of assisting onetime auto titan Carlos Ghosn in making an undeclared layover in Turkey late last year after he fled Japan inside a musical-equipment box.

title: Commerzbank's CEO and Chairman to Resign Amid Pressure From Activist Cerberus
summary: The second-largest German lender is in the midst of a deep overhaul but solid financial performance remains elusive. Germany's second-largest lender Commerzbank AG said Friday that its chief executive and chairman have submitted their resignations, as the bank faces pressure from shareholder Cerberus Capital Management for a deep overhaul due to persistent poor performance.

title: Flag-Bearing Motorcyclist Charged With Terrorism and Secession in Hong Kong
summary: The man, who police allege drove into officers, was the first to be publicly charged under China's new security law. HONG KONG-A motorcyclist who drove through Hong Kong streets during demonstrations Wednesday with a flag bearing a popular protest slogan before colliding with police officers was charged with terrorism and secession, making him the first person publicly charged under China's new national-security law.

title: China Appoints Protest and Propaganda Enforcer to Tame Hong Kong
summary: Official known for hard-line crackdowns on Chinese media and a village rebellion will lead new office to implement national-security law. HONG KONG-Beijing sent a forceful message about the enforcement of its new national-security law in Hong Kong, installing an official with experience battling protests and media as its chief enforcer, as the city's authorities brought the first charges filed under the law against a man accused of secession and terrorism.

title: Wirecard's No. 2 Was Key to the Firm's Rapid Rise. Then He Disappeared.
summary: Jan Marsalek, Wirecard's long-time chief operating officer, stopped responding to messages from colleagues when the company ran into trouble. As auditors for Wirecard AG last month prepared an announcement that they couldn't confirm the existence of more than $2 billion in cash, colleagues began calling around to locate the company's 40-year-old chief operating officer, Jan Marsalek, according to people who received inquiries about his whereabouts.

title: Vale Is Financially Able to Resume Dividends But Is Watching Coronavirus: CFO
summary: Iron-ore giant has the capacity to make distributions but is assessing pandemic's effects on Chinese demand. SÃO PAULO-Brazilian iron-ore mining giant Vale SA is financially ready to resume making divided payments after an almost two-year halt following the deadly dam failure in Brumadinho, but it is waiting to see how the coronavirus pandemic advances before making a decision, Chief Financial Officer Luciano Siani said Friday.

title: How the Covid-19 Surge Shifted to the South and West
summary: As many of the earliest-hit states crush the curve, a new wave of infections is spreading elsewhere. Americans are seeing the coronavirus pandemic play out in two parts, as states that bore the brunt of cases in the early months of the pandemic have mostly contained the spread, while a new wave of infections is now threatening much of the rest of the country.

title: Wirecard Executive's Entry Into Philippines Might Have Been Faked
summary: Philippine authorities have been searching for Jan Marsalek, who was Wirecard's Chief Operating Officer when the alleged $2 billion fraud took place. Philippine authorities searching for Jan Marsalek, the former Wirecard AG executive who ran operations for the German fintech company before it went bust, say they believe immigration documents showing he entered the country last month may have been forged.

title: Khashoggi Murder Trial of 20 Saudis Begins in Turkish Court
summary: Opening hearing took place in presence of Saudi dissident's fiancée, Hatice Cengiz, but without the defendants, whom Saudi Arabia has refused to extradite. ISTANBUL-A Turkish court has opened the trial in absentia of 20 Saudi nationals, including two with ties to the Saudi crown prince, over the murder of dissident journalist Jamal Khashoggi in Turkey, heightening pressure on the Gulf monarchy over its alleged role in an incident that shocked the world.

title: French Prime Minister Resigns, Triggering Shuffle of Macron's Government
summary: Édouard Philippe agreed with the president it was time to start a new phase; Jean Castex to replace him. PARIS-The government of President Emmanuel Macron was upended Friday following the resignation of his prime minister, Édouard Philippe, who spearheaded the president's pro-business agenda and garnered significant popularity for his handling of the coronavirus.

title: European Stocks Drift Lower With U.S. Markets Shut
summary: Dow ended the week up 3.3%, with signs of the labor market's recovery helping offset concerns about the pandemic's trajectory in the U.S.. European stocks fell Friday, with investors taking stock of a surge in coronavirus infections in the U.S. that could impede the global economic recovery.

title: New Ways to Use '529' Plans This School Year
summary: Apprenticeships now qualify as approved expenses, and leftover money can be used in more ways. For many years, "529" education-savings plans have been a tax-advantaged vehicle for parents and grandparents to accumulate funds for a child's college costs. A new law, enacted at the end of last year, has made these plans even more advantageous.

title: Facebook, Twitter, Google Face Free-Speech Test in Hong Kong
summary: New national-security law means authorities can ask companies to delete users or their content. HONG KONG-U.S. technology titans face a looming test of their free-speech credentials in Hong Kong as China's new national-security law for the city demands local authorities take measures to supervise and regulate its uncensored internet.

title: What Makes Bars and Restaurants Potential Covid-19 Hot Spots
summary: Enclosed spaces with clusters of people sharing food, talking loudly and drinking alcohol raise transmission risks. Public-health experts and government officials say they are worried bars and restaurants are playing a significant role in increasing Covid-19 case counts across parts of the U.S.

title: 'The Old Guard': Teaming Up Down the Centuries
summary: Charlize Theron plays an immortal warrior in Gina Prince-Bythewood's summer-blockbuster-flavored Netflix film..

title: Copper Slips, Halting Sharp Rebound
summary: Investors struggle to reconcile signs of a global economic recovery with the surge in coronavirus infections in the U.S.. Copper prices fell Friday, signaling a pause in the industrial metal's surge, on mounting concerns that the rally may have been overdone.

title: Eula Bingham, Who Repaired U.S. Safety Agency's Reputation, Dies
summary: Professor eliminated nitpicking regulations at OSHA and focused on what she saw as the biggest workplace risks.

title: Your Summer Escape Hits a Detour: Quarantine Chaos
summary: Planning a road trip to mountains or shore? Prepare to navigate states' ever-changing rules about coronavirus tests and self-isolating. Topside Inn in Boothbay Harbor, Maine, last month sent what was meant to be a positive email to guests booked to stay in the next few weeks.

title: Airlines' Latest Woe: Diverging Coronavirus Rates Across the Atlantic
summary: Ongoing bans on nonessential travel to Europe point to a slow recovery for an important source of airline profits. Not being able to fly to Europe may be disappointing for American vacationers. It is much worse for airlines.

title: Charlie Kaufman Says Old Hollywood, Not Netflix, Killed Movies
summary: The Oscar-winning screenwriter has a debut novel, 'Antkind,' and a coming Netflix movie: "It's infuriating to me when people say Netflix is ruining movies because-no, movies ruined movies, studios ruined movies, and that's the truth". "My box office has been terrible," says screenwriter and director Charlie Kaufman, describing the commercial flop that led to his first novel, "Antkind," a 705-page comedy about a failed film critic and a destroyed movie.

title: Banks Are Still Expected to Monitor Hemp Growers' Transactions, FinCEN Says
summary: Financial institutions should tailor anti-money-laundering programs to the risks of the industry, the U.S. Treasury unit said. Financial institutions still need to conduct due diligence and monitor transactions for hemp-related businesses, the U.S. Treasury Department's financial crime unit said, expanding on previous guidance about the industry.

title: Covid-19's Impact Won't End With a Vaccine
summary: Preparations for the next pandemic will last long after Covid-19 has slowed. That might be good news for parts of the health-care industry. The effects of the coronavirus crisis are likely to be felt on the economy for years to come. For the health-care industry that isn't entirely bad news.

title: In Diverse North Charleston, a Black Chief Tries to Bridge the Divide
summary: As recruiting Black officers proves challenging, Chief Reggie Burgess focuses on building ties in communities to address long-standing tensions. NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C.-Police Chief Reggie Burgess was in church one Sunday in February when his phone started buzzing. A young Black man had died after a standoff with several white officers. Rumors were flying that police had shot him, and upset community members wanted answers.

title: Some Senators Want to 'Go Nuclear' to Pass Democratic Priorities
summary: As hopes rise for November elections, some lawmakers see the end of the filibuster as critical to passing bills on policing, climate change, gun control. WASHINGTON-Democrats' improved prospects for winning both chambers of Congress and the White House in November have reignited calls within the party to end the Senate filibuster, lowering the bar for passing all legislation to a simple majority.

title: TikTok Tackles India App Ban, Vowing It's No Tool for Beijing
summary: CEO Kevin Mayer says China had never requested the data of Indian users, and even if it had, the company wouldn't comply. New Delhi-TikTok, a popular short-video app, sought to distance itself from Beijing after India banned it and dozens of other Chinese mobile apps in retaliation for a deadly border clash last month.

title: Can a More Powerful Taser End Police Killings?
summary: A stun-gun pioneer still views technology as a way to solve the problem, even as the deaths continue despite widespread use of the devices. Rick Smith, the man who pioneered Taser stun guns, says he wants to manufacture a next-generation Taser that is so effective police officers won't have to use their pistols anymore. But he says it will take 10 years.

title: Taser Pioneer Discusses George Floyd and Racism
summary: Axon CEO Rick Smith: 'I had presumed we were further along as a country in terms of race relations'. Rick Smith, the founder and chief executive of Axon Enterprise Inc., led development of the Taser stun gun. Now he wants his company to create a next-generation version of the electronic device to replace the police pistol. He also says Axon is seeking to establish a database on police officers' use of force. Here are edited excerpts from a recent interview with The Wall Street Journal.

title: During Covid-19 Pandemic, the Used-Car Lot Is Hot
summary: Sharp rebound in used-vehicle sales and prices offers relief for dealers, auto makers. The Covid-19 pandemic has dinged the auto sector, but one part of the industry is faring better than it was before the crisis: used cars.

title: With a Few Covid-19 Adjustments, Chinese Factory Gets Back to Work
summary: Resume Subscription.

title: China's Economy Regains Strength After Strict Coronavirus Measures
summary: Data suggest that Beijing's firm handling of pandemic has restored enough confidence to allow recovery to gather momentum. BEIJING-Economic activity is gathering momentum in China, a raft of survey data showed this week, the latest sign that Beijing's uncompromising approach to tackling the coronavirus pandemic is starting to pay dividends even as the U.S. shuts down swaths of its economy in a struggle to contain the virus.

title: How Coronavirus Is Changing July Fourth Celebrations, From Virtual Fireworks to Car Parades
summary: States and cities have revamped celebrations as confirmed virus cases continue to rise across much of the U.S.. In most of the country this holiday weekend there will be no camping out for the best parade seats. Caution tape will greet many would-be beachgoers. Fireworks shows will be scarce-or virtual.

title: Cub Investors, Taking Cues From YouTube Gurus, Help Hoist Korean Stocks
summary: 'It's not enough to just have a job anymore.' Younger South Koreans, discouraged by the economic outlook, try their hands at trading to profit from market turmoil.. Younger people in South Korea have opened hundreds of thousands of trading accounts, hoping they will profit from turbulent markets to improve their otherwise lackluster economic prospects.

title: Pence Drops In on Coronavirus Hot Spots
summary: Vice president visits states with surges in Covid-19 cases, delivering a hands-on message, while President Trump at times plays down crisis. TAMPA, Fla.-Vice President Mike Pence is parachuting into coronavirus hot spots, with brief visits designed to show the administration is taking the recent spikes in Covid-19 cases seriously even as President Trump at times plays down the severity of the crisis.

title: Millions of Hong Kongers Are Offered Chance to Emigrate to U.K.
summary: Britain says new Chinese security law in its former colony breaches bilateral treaty. LONDON-British Prime Minister Boris Johnson condemned China's decision to enforce a new national security law on Hong Kong and retaliated with new rules to make it easier for millions of people from its former colony to emigrate to the U.K.

title: Bond Markets Show a Japanese Future for U.S. Banks
summary: Gap between yields on Japan's longest-dated government bonds and those in the rest of the developed world have never been narrower. Bonds in the U.S. and much of the rest of the developed world suggest the future of interest rates is Japanese. Banking profits and monetary policy options for the U.S. are likely to follow in time.

title: America's Leaders Can't Agree on Reopening Protocols. Neither Can Families.
summary: Resume Subscription. When shelter-in-place restrictions eased in May in Gurnee, Ill., Laura Davis's immediate thought was: When are people coming over? The teacher's mother and two sisters live within driving distance, she said, and her backyard can accommodate social distancing.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Texas Mandates Face Coverings as Coronavirus Cases Surge
summary: California announces new restrictions affecting 70% of population; India extends food-aid program through November. Texas Gov. Greg Abbott changed course and required face coverings in most public settings as his state's coronavirus crisis worsened and new daily infections in the U.S. passed 50,000 for the first time, a single-day record.

title: FedEx, the Washington Redskins' Most Prominent Sponsor, Asks the Team to Change Its Name
summary: The move comes amid mounting pressure for the NFL franchise to rename itself away from a term commonly defined as a slur against Native Americans. FedEx Corp. , the Washington Redskins' most prominent sponsor and the namesake of the NFL team's stadium, called for the franchise to change its name, a company spokeswoman said.
